Class Menu1

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.World
      • Menu1
  • public class Menu1
extends greenfoot.World
    The world with all game objects, the player, the villains; the main playground.
    Version:
    November 14, 2019
    Author:
    Eric Zhang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Menu1​(int numberOfPlayers, int[] defaultQuantities, int numberOfWalls, int wallOffset)
      Constructor for Menu1 world where the player plays the game

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()
      On every act, checks to see if the player has won.
      void checkWin()
      Checks if the player has won by checking if the amount of coins in the world is zero, and then directs to a winning endcard.
      boolean doesNotIntersectAnObject​(int x, int y)
      Checks whether an entity will intersect an actor at a given location.
      void endGame()
      Called by the Player when all lives are lost, ending the game, and directing to a losing endcard.
      void generateWalls​(int amount, int wallOffset)
      Automatically generate and space walls shaped like a sideways T.
      void spawnEntitiesAndVillains​(int[] entityArray)
      Generates entities and villains in the game through quantities passed in an array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Menu1

        public Menu1​(int numberOfPlayers,
             int[] defaultQuantities,
             int numberOfWalls,
             int wallOffset)
        Constructor for Menu1 world where the player plays the game
        Parameters:
        numberOfPlayers - Either 1 or 2 players.
        defaultQuantities - An array of how many quantities of entities and villains to spawn in that differs by difficulty level.
        numberOfWalls - How many walls or obstacles the game will generate in this level.
        wallOffset - How much space should be between each wall.

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        On every act, checks to see if the player has won.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.World

      • checkWin

        public void checkWin()
        Checks if the player has won by checking if the amount of coins in the world is zero, and then directs to a winning endcard.

      • doesNotIntersectAnObject

        public boolean doesNotIntersectAnObject​(int x,
                                        int y)
        Checks whether an entity will intersect an actor at a given location.
        Parameters:
        x - - x-coordinate to check.
        y - - y-coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        True if no actor is found within a 5 pixel box around the coordinates, false otherwise.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Called by the Player when all lives are lost, ending the game, and directing to a losing endcard.

      • generateWalls

        public void generateWalls​(int amount,
                          int wallOffset)
        Automatically generate and space walls shaped like a sideways T.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of walls to generate
        wallOffset - The amount of space between each wall.

      • spawnEntitiesAndVillains

        public void spawnEntitiesAndVillains​(int[] entityArray)
        Generates entities and villains in the game through quantities passed in an array.
        Parameters:
        entityArray - An array of integers specifying how many of each entity and villain to spawn, in this order: Coins, Energies, Glues, Healths, Ghosts, Zombies (facing up/down), Zombies (facing left/right)
